arm Documentation

arm: arm

arm

  • Homepage: http://ros.org/wiki/arm

    • arm is a ROS package for controlling a Manus ARM. The package consists of one control node and two teleop nodes. You must have a Manus ARM properly connected and configured in order for this package to be of any use. You must have both a teleop node and the control node running in order to move the ARM. There is a node for keyboard teleop and a node for neuron dish activity teleop.

    Code API

    • Run the ARM control node by creating an ArmControl object.
    • Run the dish teleop node by creating a TeleopArmDish object.
    • Run the keyboard teleop node by creating a TeleopArmKey object.
    • To get an instance of the ARM: ManusArm::instance
    • To init the ARM: ManusArm::init
    • To move the ARM: ManusArm::moveCartesian and ManusArm::moveConstant
    • To check if cartesian movement is finished: ManusArm::isMoveComplete
    • To end cartesian movement early: ManusArm::setMoveComplete
    • To fold/unfold: ManusArm::fold and ManusArm::unfold
    • To get joint positions: ManusArm::getPrintState and ManusArm::getCsvState

    ROS API

    List of nodes:

    • arm_control
    • teleop_arm_dish
    • teleop_arm_key

    arm_control

    arm_control controls the ARM. It receives movement commands from teleop nodes and moves the arm hardware appropriately.

    Usage

    $ rosrun arm arm_control

    ROS topics

    Subscribes to:

    • "cartesian_moves": [arm/cartesian_moves] cartesian movement commands
    • "constant_moves": [arm/constant_move] constant movement commands
    • "constant_move_times": [arm/constant_move_time] constant movement by time commands

    Publishes to:

    • N/A

    ROS parameters

    Reads the following parameters from the parameter server

    • N/A

    Sets the following parameters on the parameter server

    • N/A

    ROS services

    • "time_service": [time_server/time_srv] polls system time to keep the node in sync

    teleop_arm_dish

    teleop_arm_dish creates movement commands for the arm based on CAT (center of activity trajectory) data received from the CAT creator node.

    Usage

    $ rosrun arm teleop_arm_dish

    ROS topics

    Subscribes to:

    • "cats": [burst_calc/cat] center of activity trajectories

    Publishes to:

    • "cartesian_moves": [arm/cartesian_moves] cartesian movement commands
    • "constant_move_times": [arm/constant_move_time] constant movement by time commands

    ROS parameters

    Reads the following parameters from the parameter server

    • arm_speed
    • arm_safe_range
    • max_range_from_midpoint

    Sets the following parameters on the parameter server

    • N/A

    ROS services

    • "time_service": [time_server/time_srv] polls system time to keep the node in sync

    teleop_arm_key

    teleop_arm_key creates movement commands for the arm based on keyboard input.

    Usage

    $ rosrun arm teleop_arm_key

    ROS topics

    Subscribes to:

    • N/A

    Publishes to:

    • "constant_moves": [arm/constant_move] constant movement commands

    ROS parameters

    Reads the following parameters from the parameter server

    • N/A

    Sets the following parameters on the parameter server

    • N/A

    ROS services

    • N/A

    Command-line tools

    There are several launch files available to simplify running all of the nodes. Each launch file has a corresponding parameter file. They are as follows:

    • brian_csv.launch
    • brian_sim.launch
    • csv.launch
    • volt_only_brian_csv.launch
    • volt_only_brian_sim.launch
    • volt_only_csv.launch

    Usage

    $ roslaunch [package] [file]
    Example
    $ roslaunch arm csv.launch
